chunks.zh: 新年第一天，你们收到了开工红包没？
chunks.en: First day of the New Year, did you receive a 'start work' red envelope?

chunks.zh: 我没有
chunks.en: I didn't.

chunks.zh: 年终都没有还想着要开工？
chunks.en: Didn't even get an end-of-year bonus and you're already thinking about the start-of-work bonus?

chunks.zh: 😅 我们发了张彩票 乐
chunks.en: 😅 We got a lottery ticket, haha

chunks.zh: 俺也没有
chunks.en: I also don't have one

chunks.zh: 什么是开工红包
chunks.en: What is a 'start work' red envelope?

chunks.zh: 听说有，但是现在没收到
chunks.en: Heard there is one, but haven't received it yet.

chunks.zh: 俺也一样（张飞抱拳）
chunks.en: Same here (Zhang Fei holding fists in salute)

chunks.zh: 今年开了不好的先例
chunks.en: This year set a bad precedent.

chunks.zh: 按照惯例应该还是 100 元
chunks.en: According to convention, it should still be 100 yuan.

chunks.zh: 在广州工作，应该是不存在没有这种情况，再不济利是应该是有的
chunks.en: Working in Guangzhou, there shouldn't be a case where there isn't one; at the very least, there should be a 'lai see' (red envelope).

chunks.zh: 昨天就上班了，并没有一点动静，就是个普通的工作日
chunks.en: Went to work yesterday and there wasn't any movement, just a normal workday.

chunks.zh: 新年公司没倒闭，真好，又活了一年
chunks.en: The company didn't go bankrupt in the New Year, great, survived another year.

chunks.zh: 5 块
chunks.en: 5 yuan

chunks.zh: 我们循例都会一大帮人扫楼
chunks.en: We habitually have a large group of people 'sweep the floors'.

chunks.zh: 应该有, 但是人事部貌似还没上班...
chunks.en: Should have one, but the HR department doesn't seem to be at work yet...

chunks.zh: 这是南方公司特有的风俗吧？开工利是。北方的公司比较少见。
chunks.en: Is this a custom specific to Southern companies? The 'start work' red envelope. It's less common in Northern companies.

chunks.zh: 收到了新年快乐，开工大吉
chunks.en: Received 'Happy New Year, Good luck at work'

chunks.zh: 收到了！ 888
chunks.en: Received! 888

chunks.zh: 没有那种东西
chunks.en: There is no such thing.

chunks.zh: 100 京东卡
chunks.en: 100 Yuan JD card
